intro: Oreosciadium scabrum, commonly known as the rough scabrous plant, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy, rough stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to southern Europe and is often found in rocky or gravelly soils. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a protected species in many regions.
